The debate will take the following form:
 
 one opening argument from me in the affirmative, followed by alternating responses where my opponent has four responses and I have three.
 
 ME
 HIM/HER
 ME
 HIM/HER
 ME
 HIM/HER
 ME
 HIM/HER
 
 The debate must stay strictly on subject, the soundness (whether or not IC is correct or accurate) is irrelevant, for this argument it is assumed that it is.
 
 I would ask that judges state why they made their decision and that this justification will be subject to an optional critique from both me and my opponent.

post_info.post_title: Resolved: The concept of irreducible complexity cannot be used to support ID
